topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5571ed8763687215132a3300#post_5571ed8763687215132a3300
This isn't a mandate it's a private method i use to avoid letting the fact i have only met 5-8 African Americans in my entire life prevent me from having a diverse cast, And i feel it can help other writers break out of a bubble they don't even notice, It's not about "you must do this!" and more about "Doing this shouldn't cause any harm and may do some good,"

[bq="Thanotos Omega"]"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5571ed8763687215132a3300#post_5571ed8763687215132a3300
This isn't a mandate it's a private method i use to avoid letting the fact i have only met 5-8 African Americans in my entire life prevent me from having a diverse cast, And i feel it can help other writers break out of a bubble they don't even notice, It's not about "you must do this!" and more about "Doing this shouldn't cause any harm and may do some good,"[/bq]
The reason why everyone hates your ideology is that you want 1984 with you as the leader.  The other reason why your ideology is so horrible is that it literally is cultural communism.  Cultural communism is the belief that society is like a monolith that you "have" to topple and become the new leader in order to "properly guide" society to a "correct" path.

Side note: if you have never read 1984 then holy fuck do you need to read it.

topics.body:
"@Thanotos Omega":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5571f6236368721e15230500#post_5571f6236368721e15230500
That's what people like you always say and yet they bitch when someone doesn't exactly adhere to their idea of diversity.

This whole whining for diversity is ridiculously overblown and petty. You could think there were no worse problems, that things like racism are pretty much beaten, that they complain so much about minor crap like this. But even when incidents, like the Mike Brown one, happen, that show clearly that it's not the case, these people care more about "diversity" in media than, you know, actual issues.

Do these people seriously believe that fiction has such a big impact on real life that diversity is such a huge issue? If they do, they really need a reality check.

topics.body:
"@Dashu":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5571f8c46368722c20880300#post_5571f8c46368722c20880300
White doll effect, our arts are so built on the concept of white being correct and normal that it completely overpowers normal beauty perceptions and makes children believe white people are by default the best, this as you can see is a problem when a person assumes that an entire race is better by default it effects them, and as i noted once before you can't use that argument without accepting that we then have to drop every other issue to wipe out child sex slavery, the existence of a bigger problem does not remove all other issues from the world, If my dad was raised with black people in media being shown in the same way as white people would he be as likely to and i kid you not call me a "Nigger lover" because i don't think unarmed people should be shot in the back?

topics.body:
Personally I would say diversity in media could be a good thing. It can speak to a larger demographic of people and make them feel included. Just...ya know. Have a good story and character behind it.

Myself. I couldn't give less of a shit if your protagonist is a black girl, white boy, indian transgender, or a squid now kid now as long as the story is good.

!http://screenrant.com/wp-content/uploads/Andrew-Garfield-Wants-Amazing-Spider-Man-to-Pass-Torch-to-Miles-Morales.jpg!

Oh Miles morales...How I love thee.

"@Dashu":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5571f8c46368722c20880300#post_5571f8c46368722c20880300
Actuaaaaallly. It has been documented that fiction can have an impact on a persons views. Like how people say "this book changed how I look at things."
